title: ParseOverflow on forge test """called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: ParseOverflow"""
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (27c9779 2023-04-12T01:40:37.519154000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test -w --mc TestFrxEthEthCurveLpDualOracle --mt testGetPrices

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: ParseOverflow

Full backtrace
export RUST_BACKTRACE=full && export RUST_BACKTRACE=1 && forge test -w --mc TestFrxEthEthCurveLpDualOracle --mt testGetPrices
[⠒] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: ParseOverflow
Location: evm/src/decode.rs:50

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
